TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a designer host for the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In a designer host, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a control that is derived from the abstract class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The class provides design-time support for controls that are derived from the in a designer host. The class properties provide the following functionality: - The property returns a object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer. - The property provides access to the designer of the data source, if one is defined. - The property gets the default view of the data source that is bound to the associated control. - The property determines whether the control should render its default action lists for choosing and creating data sources. The class methods provide the following functionality: - The method performs the actions that are necessary to connect to the current data source. - The method creates a new data source for the associated control. - The method binds the associated control that is derived from the class to a design-time data source. - The method performs the actions that are necessary to disconnect from the current data source. - The method gets a data source that can be used at design time for the associated control. - The method constructs a sample data source that can be used at design time for the associated control. - The method is used to remove properties from or add additional properties to or to shadow properties of the associated control that is derived from the class. ## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the control at design time. The example derives the `MyHierarchicalDataBoundControl` class from the . The `MyHierarchicalDataBoundControl` class is simply a copy of the . The example also derives the `MyHierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner` class from the class and places a object for the `MyHierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner` on the `MyHierarchicalDataBoundControl` class. The `MyHierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner` overrides the method to make the property visible in the **Properties** grid at design time. It overrides the method to generate the markup for a placeholder if the design time markup is `null` or , or if the design-time markup is an empty `` block (that is, if there is no inner markup between the `` and `` tags). [!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner/CS/hierarchicaldatabounddesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner/VB/hierarchicaldatabounddesigner.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property creates an empty <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool ConnectToDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs the actions that are necessary to connect to the current data source.
Docs.returns: if a connection to a new data source was performed; if the old and new data source are the same.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.ConnectToDataSource%2A> method disconnects the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.DataSourceChanged> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> events from the previous data source, and then attaches these events to the new data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void CreateDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new data source for the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.CreateDataSource%2A> method displays a dialog box that can be used to create a data source for the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The to bind to the design-time data source.
Docs.summary: Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method first sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> control to reference the design-time data source and sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> property to `null`. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> calls back to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A> method of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class to bind to the design-time data source. Finally, it restores the original values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter is the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.

Docs.summary: Provides access to the designer of the data source, when one is selected for data binding.
Docs.value: The designer for the data source of the associated control derived from the , which implements the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The data source can be accessed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property of the designer or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

Docs.summary: Gets the default view of the data source that is bound to the associated control.
Docs.value: The representing the default view of the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The data source can be accessed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property of the designer or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DisconnectFromDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs the actions that are necessary to disconnect from the current data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DisconnectFromDataSource%2A> method disconnects the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.DataSourceChanged> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> events from the current data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.
Docs.returns: An object implementing the interface that can be used as a data source for controls derived from the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For performance reasons, it is better to use a simple predefined data source at design time rather than the actual data source for the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable GetSampleDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a sample data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.
Docs.returns: An object implementing the interface that can be used as a data source for controls derived from .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The sample data constructed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.GetSampleDataSource%2A> method has a single node with an empty path.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing the of the added and shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method creates design-time properties to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner> class to change the **Properties** grid of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> control at design time. The example makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner/CS/hierarchicaldatabounddesigner.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner/VB/hierarchicaldatabounddesigner.vb#3)]

block.para: Override the method to add properties to or change the attributes of properties in the design-time property collection. Be sure to call the base method before performing other processing.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control should render its default action lists, which contain a data source ID drop-down list and related tasks.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default action lists for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner> class include a **Choose Data Source** menu item that has a drop-down list from which a data source can be selected, and any other action items on the action lists of the data source control.
Typically, the data source control action lists will include **Configure Data Source** and **Refresh Schema** menu items, although these need not always be present. The **Configure Data Source** menu item displays a dialog box that is appropriate to the type of data source chosen. For example, if the data source is an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control, the **Configure Data Source** dialog box allows you to choose a business object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource>. The **Refresh Schema** menu item refreshes the designer schema that is applied by the data source.

block.para: If you do not want the default data source action list items to be displayed, override the property to return . If you want other data source action list items to be displayed, override the to return and override the property to add the appropriate objects to the object that it returns.
